headline: Bacon and Cheddar Stuffed Mushrooms
description: Crimini mushrooms are stuffed with Cheddar cheese and bacon. This appetizer is an impressive and irresistible accompaniment to any meal.
name: Bacon and Cheddar Stuffed Mushrooms

recipeInstructions.text: Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Drain, dice and set aside.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Remove mushroom stems. Set aside caps. Chop the stems.
In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Slowly cook and stir the chopped stems and onion until the onion is soft. Remove from heat.
In a medium bowl, stir together the mushroom stem mixture, bacon and 1/2 cup Cheddar. Mix well and scoop the mixture into the mushroom caps.
Bake in the preheated oven 15 minutes, or until the cheese has melted.
Remove the mushrooms from the oven, and sprinkle with the remaining cheese.

review.reviewBody: It was awesome. I actually melted some of the cheese with the stems and onion. It made the mixture stick together well for stuffing the caps.

This recipe was simple and delicious! The only thing I did differently was pre-cooked the mushrooms in the oven for 15 minutes, poured off the extra liquid and then added stuffing and cooked an additional 15 minutes. I also used another reviewer‘s tip and used a melon Baller to take out the stems. Lovely idea! Excellent recipe! Will make again! Thank you!
Holy cow... I am a 13-year old amateur and had no trouble completing the recipe, added a smidge of salt, and my entire family devoured it. Definitely a keeper.
They are too wet. Maybe breadcrumbs or bake them empty first?

I loved it. Used a hard Jasper Hill l’s farmhouse cheese instead of plain cheddar. I also used turkey bacon instead of pork based bacon, and I added one clove of garlic (chopped) to the last two minutes of the sauté step. It turned out delish.
Very good !! Will make again for sure!!!
I'm not a mushroom lover, but everyone else in the family is. The only change I made was to add some minced garlic to the sautee mixture. They're a hit every time.
made these last night for dinner and omgoodness...absolutely delicious. I added some crushed garlic to the onion. So good!
Delicious!
Everyone loved these and they are really easy. Great choice for an appetizer if you don't have a lot of time.

The only thing to do differently is to bake the mushrooms a bit first to get rid of the moisture in the cups so when you see the mushroom caps filled with water take out and dump out the moisture then fill
They were great, I added a bit of ham. Loved the mushroom flavors!
Yum! Keto friendly and oh so good. I make these as a side dish with a protein for dinner.
My family loved these!
I made this following the recipe and we felt it was lacking flavor. I won't make this again.
I used turkey bacon instead and food processed it. Also, I used all the guts of the mushroom in my filling. Excellent and easy.
My husband and I loved these. The recipe is very quick and easy and tastes fantastic!
Delicious. Everyone loved this made no changes
Rave reviews at parties and family gatherings, note that filling makes more than needed so I have crackers and a small bowl of filling on the side as well. great taste!
Overall the flavor was ok , but it was like it was missing something. It had a strange aftertaste I guess.
This is SOOOOOOO easy and yummy. Perfect for a quick appetizer!
Easy. Delicous. Perfection. Thank you~!

This was wonderful. I used 3 cheese blend with extra mozzarella. Cooked all ingredients together except mushroom caps. After stuffing mushrooms put extra stuffing on to of them. More stuffing than the tops can hold I put it in a foil pack and popped it in the crock pot so it wouldn't heat the house up. I cooked in crock pot for about 1 and 1/2 hours.
Delicious

Super easy and super good. I made them once without modifications and then I made them again and changed a whole bunch of stuff. The original recipe is good, but some people may find it a little bland. If so, try adding garlic, parsley, parmesan and oregano to the stuffing. If you're worried about it being greasy, you can add some bread crumbs, too. Either way, it's a great snack or side dish for a light entree.
I made it with portabellas and cherry wood smoked bacon. The husband loved them!

In the process of making these now. If you follow the recipe it'll take longer than 30 minutes total to cook this. 15 min to cook bacon, 10 minutes to cook mushroom stems, 15 minutes to cook stuffed mushrooms, and that is not counting cleaning and chopping time.

They all went! A sure sign of success. But a word to the wise. The ingredients as written was twice as much as needed to fill my mushrooms. I bought medium to small for ease in eating as finger food. Thankfully, I bought twice as many mushrooms and figured I would do something with the remainder. So one recipe of the filling for me filled double the mushrooms. They were great, however. Everyone loved them!
They were pretty bland on taste. I will look for something with more spice and maybe some parmesan cheese. I like a lot of spice with my foods.
Delicious and very easy to make. My mom tried them and said they were great. She so hard to please, check one off for me
loved this. I used bacon bits instead of real bacon.

I added green chili and mozzarella cheese to the mix and they were absolutely delicious. My non mushrooms hating family members enjoyed these with no complaints. It was a little bit too oily so next time I will not use so much butter. Can't wait to try these again for a potluck event.

These were perfect ... especially because I had gluten sensitive friends attending. I made exactly as written the first time but the second time I added minced garlic and a bit of spice to add additional ZING.
Great we loved it

I have not actually made this yet, but have a question for anyone who has...can you make this ahead of time and refrigerate it? I want to make it for a baby shower but need to keep it cold for a 2 hour drive. Any input would be really appreciated!
I made this basic concept with a pound of sausage instead of bacon and it was epic!!!
Made for a Superbowl party, used baby bella mushrooms, turkey bacon and added a couple of tablespoons of panko bread crumbs to the stuffing mix. Everyone loved them!
my family loves this recipe, the only thing I do differently is I add crushed Goldfish to the mixture before baking to make them a bit more filling. ??
Delicious !!
These were a huge hit! Very easy and simply to make. The leftover stuffing I melted on pita chips. Everyone loved them!!
My friends and family could not stop eating them. About to make a new batch for thanksgiving office luncheon and dinner party. Very simple and very yummy!!
I used a cast iron skillet to sauté the stems them used the same pan for the filled mushrooms in the oven. The recipe was delicious! The leftover filling made a great topping for baked potatoes.

I've made these multiple times, and they are always a big hit. I do add bread to the stuffing, as suggested. I dice two slices of good sandwich bread, then bake them in the oven until the are dry before adding them to the stuffing. I love the different texture they add, and the mushrooms are less dense.

My husband loved this. The only changes I made was to make about 5 times the amount and used 6 large mushroom caps instead of the small ones and bought some already pre-sliced mushrooms to take place of the stems when I cooked them. He said this would be phenomenal if we were to add it in top of a burger (since we used the large ones.) I don't like mushrooms and I even thought this was pretty good.
Really yummy appetizer! I used Extra Virgin Olive oil instead of butter, red onion and I added 1 minced garlic clove. Turned out great, it's super easy & the kids even loved them!
I made these. they were delicious. easy to made.
I think I will probably use bigger mushrooms next time, just because the flavor of the stem mix was rather overwhelming compared to others. Otherwise, it was extremely tasty!

Personally, I don't like mushrooms, but I made this for my wife. We didn't have any cheddar, so I put in a mix of pepper jack and colby jack cheese instead. She absolutely loves it. According to her, they are the best she's ever had!

The dish was also incredibly easy to make. Well done!

These were awesome! I also added a tbsp of panko bread crumbs and 1/2 clove of garlic. I swapped out the cheddar cheese for 1/2 cup of blue cheese. I am a big fan of using a kitchen scissors so when i cook bacon intended to be crumbled I start by peeling off how many strips I need in one chunk and then cut with the scissors into the pan before cooking.
Nice change from cream cheese stuffed mushrooms. We enjoyed them. Will probably use this recipe as a base and try some variations on the stuffing.
made these for Thanksgiving and it was a huge hit! Super easy to make and can be prepped ahead of time.
I made these for the first time but I added cream cheese to the onion mixture and my husband loved them! I will for sure make these again!
Easy to make. My picky husband even liked them thanks to the bacon.

If you have a food processor, use that to sauté and mix the stems, onions, and bacon together. Once this is done, really cram and press as much filling in the mushroom as possible. You will be surprised how much you will be able to stuff in there. Then sprinkle cheese over the mushroom/filling.
So good. I did add waterchestnuts because we like the extra crunch.
All I can say is these were excellent. Followed the recipe and I gobbled them up.
so easy to make

I made one change to the recipe and that was adding all the cheese to mixture before stuffing the caps. Did not do it on purpose but they turned out great. 
I did cook a little longer than suggested to get the cheese to melt. 
I don't know what anyone else thinks about them because I ate them all myself.
Fun, easy, delicious recipe!
Loved by all at our Thanksgiving dinner!

Love these, I made them for my fussy son and he thought they were excellent. The cooking time was just right because the oven temp is so high. And it is so easy and fast. Having them this xmas eve again ??Thanks ??
So good! I added a small about of Panko bread crumbs and I think that gave it a little texture. Also used precooked bacon pieces. They turned out great! Especially tasty right out of the oven!

I don't usually write reviews but this DEFINITELY deserved it! Followed the recipe but doubled it and cooked onions in bacon renderings. Served for Christmas Eve buffet. everyone who have one, the first words out of your mouth for oh my god! They have to have been the best tasting just not sure I have ever had! Thank you
My daughter makes these all the time. Everyone LOVES them. Make sure to use crimini mushrooms. We tried to use button mushrooms once and they were too watery. Thank you for a great recipe.
Delicious! My husband & I had these for dinner tonight & they were a hit. Will definitely make them again.
Wonderful!! Cannot make this often enough at our house. Have to buy mushrooms all the time for this and definitely an easy recipe if you're low on time.
These were delicious and so easy to make! I made a wonderful low carb dinner out of this!

Very good, just a bit salty. I'm going to try using reduced-fat cheddar next time. Otherwise great texture. Oh! And check on them on the low end of the recommended cooking time. They're not very forgiving with even the slightest overcook. Tasty though and worth the effort. Thank you!

This is a good flavor combination. I did add some onion roll breadcrumbs, and I made sure I drained the bacon very well on paper towels. After reading other reviews, I added some chopped fresh sage and a dash or two of Spike seasoning to kick things up a notch. My hubby liked them, which is unusual because he doesn't like new things.
These are great. I have made them replacing the bacon with 1/4lb Italian sausage (uncooked)and baked for 25min. They turned out excellent as well.
Yummy! Very easy to make. I used white button mushrooms and they turned out perfect. I will definitely make these again! Great for the THM eating plan.
These turned out yummy, juicy and flavorful. the only thing different is I used salad bacon and it was so easy to use. Thanks, Happy Cooking!
These were terrific. My family devoured them. Do not change a thing.

I have made these a couple different ways. It's perfect without any changes. The first time I made it I did add a small amount of cream cheese to the filling for a creamier version. It's the perfect appetizer for any party. If your short on time, you can decrease prep time, and use real bacon bits, and skipped the onions. Perfect!

I made these for Thanksgiving this year and my husband asked me to make them again for Christmas. He LOVED them! I didn't give this recipe 5 stars because I did alter the recipe a bit. I wanted a little creamier stuffing than just melted cheddar would give so I added 4oz of cream cheese, I kept the same amount of shredded cheddar. I also added a little bit of garlic powder, about 1/8 tsp. Yummy!
Always a big hit at get together!!!
I made them yesterday for my 3daughters,they were good but just had lots of juices so i going to try the bread crumbs, but we loved them:)
Made this twice and both times it was a mega hit with my friends!
awesome...

AMAZING! The only thing I did differently was added a teaspoon of minced garlic to the sauteed mushroom stems and onions. Served as an appetizer but these would also make a nice main dish. Will double the recipe next time as I only got to eat two and my hubby and son scarfed down the rest!

Doubled the mushrooms but not the cheese. Next time I will salt and pepper the caps before stuffing. Used cocnut oil for half the butter. They were great! Had them for dinner entree, made a very generous maindish for two.
Very moist & flavorful. I've made this recipe a couple of times & it's always been a crowd pleaser, for those who love mushrooms of course!!!
Great flavor combo.

Excellent recipe! Made 30 to take to a party. I baked a full pound of low sodium bacon for a consistent doneness then cut that up. As others did, I used the bacon grease to cook the mushrooms and onions. Since some mentioned that the finished mushrooms were greasy, I used 50% less fat cheddar. A handful of Gouda and Gorgonzola were then thrown in the cheese mixture. (About 3 cups cheese total as per the serving size calculator). No need for bread crumbs thankfully. I also added a teaspoon of thyme to the cheese mixture to give an herbier flavor. As someone else suggested, I brushed the mushrooms with olive oil using a garlic infused oil. Very tasty!

I make this often. My husband will bring home all ingreds with a "please" smile on his face. I also add small bits of bread to decrease the oil. So simple and easy to make, we all just love them at my house..
I used white button mushrooms- turned out delicious!!!
Cheese and bacon--how could this not be good? Easy, fast, delicious.
quick and easy!
A very nice overall recipe. Followed recipe exactly and they came out good. Everyone liked them.
These were just okay. Not bad, but I probably wouldn't make them again.

this is really a tasty treat. i made a smaller batch for myself just to try it. i did make a few changes. instead of browning the bacon right away, i went ahead and made the mixture of cheese and mushroom stems first. if you want your mushrooms to have a more interesting texture, make your bacon at the end, and make it crispy. also, dont diced up the bacon into really tiny pieces. make them a bit larger. then, mix up the hot bacon with the cheese and mushrooms and bake. the cheese melts a little faster from the hot bacon, and it gives it a great texture. just be quitting the bacon mixed up and in the oven. sizzle away!

Delicious and easy! I doubled the recipe and used half an onion, cooked low and long before adding the mushroom stems. I also put the mushrooms in the oven to soften a bit before stuffing them. Everyone liked them!
I made these but put fresh chopped avocado in the bottom of the mushrooms then added the green onion and chopped bacon then topped it with shredded cheese and parm.
SOOOO GOOOD =)
These were pretty good, but need a little something extra like either cream cheese, or a spicy sausage. They are also quite greasy.
My husband begs me to make these. I have used all different kinds of mushrooms and follow this recipe. Always a crowd pleaser.
Best mushroom recipe on Allrecipes. Usually add a little extra bacon because I am a bacon lover
These are so good. I didn't change a thing. How do you go wrong with bacon and cheese.
My husband I finished these quickly before dinner was ready....They were so good and so easy to make. I will continue making these ones!!
